member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.ChatServerAuthenticationInfo
member.summary: Authentication info of a chat server client. This is created by the chatserver through and the chat client needs to provide all of this information to authenticate itself.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.ChatServerAuthenticationInfo.#ctor(System.Byte,System.UInt16,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The index of the client in the room.
The address of the chat server which hosts the chat room.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.ChatServerAuthenticationInfo.Index
member.summary: Gets the index of the client in the room.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.ChatServerAuthenticationInfo.RoomId
member.summary: Gets the room identifier of the room which is reserved for the client.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.ChatServerAuthenticationInfo.ClientName
member.summary: Gets the name of the client, usually character name.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.ChatServerAuthenticationInfo.AuthenticationToken
member.summary: Gets the authentication token. It's like a random passwort which the client has to provide to enter the chat room.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.ChatServerAuthenticationInfo.HostAddress
member.summary: Gets the (IP-)address of the chat server which hosts the chat room.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.ChatServerAuthenticationInfo.AuthenticationRequiredUntil
member.summary: Gets the datetime until a authentication of at least two clients is required. If this time passed by, the chat room will be closed automatically.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.Guild
member.summary: A guild is a group of players who like to play together.
member.remarks: You may wonder where the Id is. The original server and this uses an integer id for guilds, too. I decided to manage these keys in memory and on demand, they are not persistent. I could've used an integer Id as primary key in the persistent Guild class, but don't do it by purpose: We would lose the ability to easily merge two databases (realms), if we do that. Even if we use a separate integer id column in the database, it needs to be re-assigned after a merge.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.Guild.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.Guild.Logo
member.summary: Gets or sets the logo.
member.remarks: It's like a 16 color 8x8 pixel bitmap, therefore has a size of 32 bytes.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.Guild.Score
member.summary: Gets or sets the score.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.Guild.Notice
member.summary: Gets or sets the guild notice which can be set by the guild master.
member.remarks: Visible in green color after a character entered the game.

member.name: P:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.Guild.Hostility
member.summary: Gets or sets the hostile guild. Members of a hostile guild can be killed without consequences.

member.name: T:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.IGuildServer
member.summary: Interface for the guild server.
member.remarks: A little note about the guild id: The original GMO server uses an 32-bit integer in all of its messages. However, actually it's only using (or used?) 16 bits of it for created guilds (see struct SDHP_GUILDCREATED). Some people may remember the "guildbug" on GMO - I guess the keys exceeded these 16 bits and somehow caused a crash... but after restart of the servers it started working again.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.IGuildServer.GuildExistsAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if the guild with the specified name exists.
member.returns: True, if the guild exists; False, otherwise.

member.summary: Gets the guild by the guild identifier.
member.returns: The guild.

member.name: M:MUnique.OpenMU.Interfaces.IGuildServer.GetGuildIdByNameAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the guild id by the guild name.
member.returns: The guild id. 0, if not found.

member.summary: Creates the guild and sets the guild master online at the guild server. A separate call to is not required.
member.param: The identifier of the server on which the guild is getting created.
member.returns: A flag, indicating if the guild has been created successfully.
